attributes.additional_details:
Decriminalise Prostitution and  Drug Abuse

Prostitution should be given a new status in society that of providing a service. Prostitutes should be registered , have regular health checks, pay income tax and NI and  encouraged to carry out their profession in authorised premises. Clients should pay as part of their fees a  health tax to be used to  provide suitable clinical  facilities to protect and treat prostitutes and clients from sexually transmitted  diseases.

 Drug Abuse.   Initially use of class B and C drugs should be decriminalised. They should be made available through  authorised premises . Manufacture should be through  pharmaceutical companies to ensure quality control
